ecosystem_specific.description: The meaning of the values within the object is entirely defined by the ecosystem

detailed_summary.description:
overloading in places with 'RiskAssessment' and other places with
'Description'

description_ru.description: Библиотека libxml2 до версии 2.9.12 не корректно обрабатывает XML-документы, содержащие определенные сущности. В результате могут быть выполнены произвольные команды.

name_ru.description: BDU:2022-03833: Уязвимость модуля Cboot (tegrabl_cbo.c) пакета драйверов микропрограммного обеспечения вычислительных плат NVIDIA Jetson, позволяющая нарушителю выполнить произвольный код или вызвать частичный отказ в обслуживании

solution_ru.description: Обновите драйверы микропрограммного обеспечения вычислительных плат NVIDIA Jetson до версии 32.6.1 или более поздней

text_ru.description: Библиотека libxml2 до версии 2.9.12 не корректно обрабатывает XML-документы, содержащие определенные сущности. В результате могут быть выполнены произвольные команды.

date_last_revised.description:
if in the future we can delete this great - it's just a dupe to
normalize the field names

document.description:
Document contains metadata about the CSAF document itself.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#321-document-property

notes.description:
Notes holds notes associated with the whole document.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3217-document-property---notes

product_tree.description:
ProductTree contains information about the product tree (branches only).

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#322-product-tree-property

vulnerabilities.description:
Vulnerabilities contains information about the vulnerabilities,
(i.e. CVEs), associated threats, and product status.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#323-vulnerabilities-property

cve.description:
MITRE standard Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) tracking number for the vulnerability.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3232-vulnerabilities-property---cve

flags.description:
Machine readable flags for products related to vulnerability

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3235-vulnerabilities-property---flags

ids.description:
List of IDs represents a list of unique labels or tracking IDs for the vulnerability (if such information exists).

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3236-vulnerabilities-property---ids

notes.description:
Notes holds notes associated with the Vulnerability object.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3238-vulnerabilities-property---notes

product_status.description:
Provide details on the status of the referenced product related to the vulnerability.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#3239-vulnerabilities-property---product-status

references.description:
Vulnerability references holds a list of references associated with this vulnerability item.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#32310-vulnerabilities-property---references

remediations.description:
Provide details of remediations associated with a Vulnerability

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#32312-vulnerabilities-property---remediations

scores.description:
Scores holds the scores associated with the Vulnerability object.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#32313-vulnerabilities-property---scores
Currently only CVSS v3 is supported.

threats.description:
Provide details of threats associated with a vulnerability.

https://docs.oasis-open.org/csaf/csaf/v2.0/os/csaf-v2.0-os.html#32314-vulnerabilities-property---threats

title.description:
Aggregate severity is a vehicle that is provided by the document producer to convey the urgency and
criticality with which the one or more vulnerabilities reported should be addressed.

type.description: the json for this is missing/broke

exploited.description:
This field is exploited field from endpoint /api/vulnerabilities.
apidocs : https://euvd.enisa.europa.eu/apidoc
Note: There are records where exploited_since is populated with a valid date,
but it still shows up under non_exploitable data set

id.description: not all of them have this

date_last_revised.description: could nuke this at some pt in the future as it's a dupe

exploitability_ease.description: seems like only 3 vals for this

affected.description: Affected will list out the vulnerable versions.

aliases.description: Aliases are other identifiers that refer to this, such as a CVE

modified.description: Modified is non-zero Time if entry was updated

published.description: Published is the datetime when this was released

references.description: References are links to more detailed advisories, fixes, etc.

was_withdrawn.description: WasWD indicates if the advisory was withdrawn or not.

withdrawn.description: Withdrawn is non-zero if this advisory has been withdrawn

packages.description: used to index into vulncheck OS

aliases.description:
Vulnerability aliases, e.g. CVE IDs (optional but recommended)
Request a CVE for your RustSec vulns: https://iwantacve.org/

categories.description:
Optional: Categories this advisory falls under. Valid categories are:
"code-execution", "crypto-failure", "denial-of-service", "file-disclosure"
"format-injection", "memory-corruption", "memory-exposure", "privilege-escalation"

cvss.description:
Optional: a Common Vulnerability Scoring System score. More information
can be found on the CVSS website, https://www.first.org/cvss/.

date.description: Disclosure date of the advisory as an RFC 3339 date (mandatory)

informational.description:
Optional: Indicates the type of informational security  advisory
 - "unsound" for soundness issues
 - "unmaintained" for crates that are no longer maintained
 - "notice" for other informational notices

keywords.description: Freeform keywords which describe this vulnerability, similar to Cargo (optional)

references.description: URL to additional helpful references regarding the advisory (optional)

related.description:
Related vulnerabilities (optional)
e.g. CVE for a C library wrapped by a -sys crate)

rustsec_id.description:
Identifier for the advisory (mandatory). Will be assigned a "RUSTSEC-YYYY-NNNN"
identifier e.g. RUSTSEC-2018-0001. Please use "RUSTSEC-0000-0000" in PRs.

url.description:
URL to a long-form description of this issue, e.g. a GitHub issue/PR,
a change log entry, or a blogpost announcing the release (optional)

last_update.description: could potentially kill this in the future as it's a dupe

documentGenerationDate.description: the deep tag instructs deep.Equal to ignore this field (used during OpenSearch loading)

_timestamp.description: ignore this field when checking for differences/changes

nvd_last_modified.description:
it's often the case the nvd record was updated, but in a way that is irrelevant to the contents
of a vc exploits record.

metricV40.description: this isn't called baseMetric, because it can contain other metrics -- typically supplemental metrics

artifacts.description: Artifacts holds the set of available artifacts for this vulnerability, such as exploit, shodan queries, PCAP traces, and others.

cve.description: CVE identifier for the given initial access record.

inKEV.description: InKEV is true if this artifact is in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) data set; otherwise, false.

inVCKEV.description: InVCKEV is true if this artifact is in VulnCheck's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (VCKEV) data set; otherwise, false.

vulnerable_cpes.description: VulnerableCPEs is the list of vulnerable CPE strings associated with this CVE and artifact(s).

artifactName.description: ArtifactName is a title to associate with this artifact.

artifactsURL.description: ArtifactsURL are URLs to the available artifact.

censysLegacyQueries.description: CensysLegacyQueries are legacy queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Censys in URL form.

censysLegacyRawQueries.description: CensysLegacyRawQueries are raw legacy queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Censys.

censysQueries.description: CensysQueries are queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Censys in URL form.

censysRawQueries.description: CensysRawQueries are raw queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Censys.

cloneSSHURL.description: CloneSSHURL is the git URL to clone the artifact with.

dateAdded.description: DateAdded is when this artifact entry was first added to the InitialAccess data set.

driftnetQueries.description: DriftnetQueries are queries for examining Internet exposed services with Driftnet.

driftnetRawQueries.description: DriftnetRawQueries are queries for examining Internet exposed services with Driftnet.

exploit.description: Exploit indicates whether or not an exploit is available in this artifact.

fofaQueries.description: FOFAQueries are raw queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with FOFA.

greynoiseQueries.description: GreynoiseQueries are queries for finding the vulnerability via honeypot data.

nmapScript.description: NmapScript indicates whether or not an nmap script for scanning environment exists in this artifact.

pcap.description: PCAP indicates whether of not a package capture of the exploit PoC exploiting a vulnerable system exists in this artifact.

product.description: Product are the software that has the vulnerability.

shodanQueries.description: ShodanQueries are queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Shodan in URL form.

shodanRawQueries.description: ShodanRawQueries are raw queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with Shodan.

sigmaRule.description: SigmaRule indicates whether or not a Sigma rule designed to detect the exploitation of the vulnerability over the network exists in this artifact.

snortRule.description: SnortRule indicates whether or not a Snort rule designed to detect the exploitation of the vulnerability over the network exists in this artifact.

suricataRule.description: SuricataRule indicates whether or not a Suricata rule designed to detect the exploitation of the vulnerability over the network exists in this artifact.

targetDocker.description: TargetDocker indicates whether or not there is an available docker image with the vulnerability.

targetService.description: TargetService indicates the service (HTTP, FTP, etc) that this exploit targets.

versionScanner.description: VersionScanner indicates whether or not the exploit PoC can determine if target system is vulnerable without sending exploit payload in this artifact.

yara.description: YARA indicates whether or not a YARA rule designed to detect the exploit on an endpoint exists in this artifact.

zeroday.description: Zeroday indicates whether or not it is a VulnCheck zeroday.

zoomEyeQueries.description: ZoomEyeQueries are raw queries for examining potential Internet-exposed devices & applications with ZoomEye.

_timestamp.description: the deep tag instructs deep.Equal to ignore this field (used during OpenSearch loading)

value.description: hex string digest or link to hash

entitlements.description: Entitlements provides a map of roles to a list of entitlements

href.description: Href API endpoint URI to detailed backup information
Href API endpoint URI to detailed index information

get.description: Return a list of indexes with backup and endpoint links that the user has access to

get.description:
### Overview
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a paginated list of all documents from the 7zip index. \
By default, a maximum of 100 documents are shown per page.

**Index Description:** 7Zip Security Advisories

### Paging Over Large Data (cursor)
In order to allow users to iterate over large index datasets, this endpoint provides a server-side
"cursor" mechanism. To use the cursor, first call `GET /index/7zip?start_cursor`, the response will
have a `next_cursor` id that clients will need to pass as a query parameter to the next request like
`GET /index/7zip?cursor=<next_cursor_id>`

parameters.description: set the page number of the response
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: limit the number of findings in the response
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: continue server-side paging using a cursor id
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: request server-side paging
parameters.name: start_cursor

parameters.description: Specify a CVE ID to search with.
parameters.name: cve

parameters.description: Specify a vulnerability alias to search with.
parameters.name: alias

parameters.description: Specify an IAVA ID to search with.
parameters.name: iava

parameters.description: Specify a JVNDB ID to search with.
parameters.name: jvndb

parameters.description: Specify an ILVN ID to search with.
parameters.name: ilvn

parameters.description: Specify a threat actor name to search with.
parameters.name: threat_actor

parameters.description: Specify a MITRE ID to search with.
parameters.name: mitre_id

parameters.description: Specify a MISP ID to search with.
parameters.name: misp_id

parameters.description: Specify a ransomeware family name to search with.
parameters.name: ransomware

parameters.description: Specify a botnet name to search with.
parameters.name: botnet

parameters.description: Specify a published date
parameters.name: published

parameters.description: Specify a starting published date to filter with.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: Specify an ending published date to filter with.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: Specify a starting 'updated-at' date to filter with.
parameters.name: updatedAtStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending 'updated-at' date to filter with.
parameters.name: updatedAtEndDate

parameters.description: Specify a starting last modified date to filter with.
parameters.name: lastModStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending last modified date to filter with.
parameters.name: lastModEndDate

parameters.description: Specify a starting published date to filter with.
parameters.name: pubStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending published date to filter with.
parameters.name: pubEndDate

get.summary: Return vulnerability data stored in index "7zip"

### Overview
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a paginated list of all documents from the adobe index. \
By default, a maximum of 100 documents are shown per page.

This endpoint allows you to retrieve a paginated list of all documents from the amd index. \
By default, a maximum of 100 documents are shown per page.

**Index Description:** AMD Security Bulletins

### Paging Over Large Data (cursor)
In order to allow users to iterate over large index datasets, this endpoint provides a server-side
"cursor" mechanism. To use the cursor, first call `GET /index/amd?start_cursor`, the response will
have a `next_cursor` id that clients will need to pass as a query parameter to the next request like
`GET /index/amd?cursor=<next_cursor_id>`

parameters.description: set the page number of the response
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: limit the number of findings in the response
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: continue server-side paging using a cursor id
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: request server-side paging
parameters.name: start_cursor

parameters.description: Specify a CVE ID to search with.
parameters.name: cve

parameters.description: Specify a vulnerability alias to search with.
parameters.name: alias

parameters.description: Specify an IAVA ID to search with.
parameters.name: iava

parameters.description: Specify a JVNDB ID to search with.
parameters.name: jvndb

parameters.description: Specify an ILVN ID to search with.
parameters.name: ilvn

parameters.description: Specify a threat actor name to search with.
parameters.name: threat_actor

parameters.description: Specify a MITRE ID to search with.
parameters.name: mitre_id

parameters.description: Specify a MISP ID to search with.
parameters.name: misp_id

parameters.description: Specify a ransomeware family name to search with.
parameters.name: ransomware

parameters.description: Specify a botnet name to search with.
parameters.name: botnet

parameters.description: Specify a published date
parameters.name: published

parameters.description: Specify a starting published date to filter with.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: Specify an ending published date to filter with.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: Specify a starting 'updated-at' date to filter with.
parameters.name: updatedAtStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending 'updated-at' date to filter with.
parameters.name: updatedAtEndDate

parameters.description: Specify a starting last modified date to filter with.
parameters.name: lastModStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending last modified date to filter with.
parameters.name: lastModEndDate

parameters.description: Specify a starting published date to filter with.
parameters.name: pubStartDate

parameters.description: Specify an ending published date to filter with.
parameters.name: pubEndDate

get.summary: Return vulnerability data stored in index "amd"

This endpoint allows you to retrieve a paginated list of all documents from the huawei-euleros index. \
By default, a maximum of 100 documents are shown per page.

**Index Description:** OpenEuler Operating System Security Advisories

### Paging Over Large Data (cursor)
In order to allow users to iterate over large index datasets, this endpoint provides a server-side
"cursor" mechanism. To use the cursor, first call `GET /index/huawei-euleros?start_cursor`, the response will
have a `next_cursor` id that clients will need to pass as a query parameter to the next request like
`GET /index/huawei-euleros?cursor=<next_cursor_id>`

parameters.description: set the page number of the response
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: limit the number of findings in the response
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: continue server-side paging using a cursor id
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: request server-side paging
parameters.name: start_cursor
